title: Improving Collision-Free Success Rate For Object Goal Visual Navigation Via Two-Stage Training With Collision Prediction
author: Shiwei Lian (Peking University), Feitian Zhang (Peking University), ...
relevance_why: The methods proposed can enhance navigation strategies in complex environments, which may be applicable to audio-visual integration in multi-modal tasks, potentially benefiting applications in audio generation systems.
background: The task involves navigating to a specific target object using only RGB visual inputs while avoiding obstacles, a key challenge in robotic navigation.
contribution: This paper introduces a two-stage training method with collision prediction to enhance the collision-free success rate of existing navigation models, achieving significant improvements in navigation performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often neglect collision during training, leading to conservative navigation policies that limit task success.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work implements a dual training stage: one for learning to predict collisions during exploration and another for navigating to the target while minimizing collision risks.

key_innovation: The integration of a collision prediction module during training stages allows agents to avoid over-conservatism while learning effective navigation paths.
real_world_impact: The proposed methods can directly benefit robotic navigation systems in dynamic environments, potentially leading to safer and more efficient robots.
limitations: Limitations include reliance on RGB visuals which may hinder performance in environments with poor lighting or visibility.

new_terms.collision-free success: **Collision-free success** refers to a navigation task being deemed successful only if the agent reaches the target without any collisions occurring along the path.
